medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient presented with an asymptomatic cavitating mass in the right upper lung. A CT performed 5 months prior revealed a small nodular lesion in the same location, which was unchanged at the time of presentation.
medical_history.past_medical_history: The patient has a history of chronic obstructive pulmonary disease, hypertension, coronary artery disease, and normal-pressure hydrocephalus treated with a ventriculoperitoneal shunt. He had been on inhaled fluticasone for 12 years without systemic corticosteroids.
